decision_conditions: The Oak tree (T1 on the application) is situated within the rear garden of 29 Nicholas Way. It is surrounded by other mature trees which as a group helps to provide a gradual transition of mature tree cover between the dwellings in the copse wood estate and the nearby Ruislip woods National Nature Reserve (NNR)

The oak contributes to local biodiversity, and significantly contributes to the amenity and arboreal / wooded character of the Copsewood Estate Area of Special Local Character. The Oak has a moderate amenity value.

The rear garden of 29 Nicholas Way is well vegetated with a number of trees and shrubs closer to the area of damage than the Oak (T1 on application) which they have applied to fell. The claim assessment report only makes reference to a broadleaf group within 5m of the property being within the potential influencing distance of the property and no reference to the Oak. There are also two other oak trees (T2 and T3) of similar size and distance from the damage but the a
The removal of deadwood, dangerous / hanging branches and ivy:  This does not require the formal consent of the Council.
description: To fell one Oak within Area 1 (T1 on application), on TPO 396
